004package kut;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.function.Supplier;
008import java.util.function.Predicate;
009import java.util.function.BiPredicate;
010import java.util.function.Consumer;
011import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
012import java.util.function.Function;
013import java.util.function.BiFunction;
014
015/** Iterator */
016public class Iter<T> {
017  final Supplier<Opt<T>> fnext;
018
019  /**
020   * Constructor.
021   * @param next Function that returns the next element or 'Opt.none' if there
022   * are no more elements.
023   */
024  public Iter (Supplier<Opt<T>> next) {
025    fnext = next;
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Constructor.
030   * @param es Elements.
031   */
032  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
033  public Iter (T... es) {
034    ArrayList<T> a = Arr.mk(es);
035    fnext = () ->
036      a.isEmpty()
037        ? Opt.none()
038        : Opt.some(a.remove(0))
039    ;
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Constructor.
044   * @param a Array.
045   */
046  public Iter (ArrayList<T> a) {
047    ArrayList<T> a2 = Arr.copy(a);
048    fnext = () ->
049      a2.isEmpty()
050        ? Opt.none()
051        : Opt.some(a2.remove(0))
052    ;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Constructor.
057   * @param l Lst.
058   */
059  public Iter (Lst<T> l) {
060    Wrap<Lst<T>> lw = new Wrap<>(l);
061    fnext = () -> {
062      Lst<T> l2 = lw.e;
063      if (l2.isEmpty()) return Opt.none();
064      lw.e = l2.tail();
065      return Opt.some(l2.head());
066    };
067  }
068
069
070
071  /**
072   * Returns 'true' if every element of 'this' returns 'true' with 'f'.
073   * @param f Function to test elements.
074   * @return 'true' if every element of 'this' returns 'true' with 'f'.
075   */
076  public boolean all (Predicate<T> f) {
077    Opt<T> e;
078    for (;;) {
079      e = fnext.get();
080      if (e.isNone()) return true;
081      if (!f.test(e.getValue())) return false;
082    }
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Returns 'true' if at least an element of 'this' returns 'true' with 'f'.
087   * @param f Function to test elements.
088   * @return 'true' if at least an element of 'this' returns 'true' with 'f'.
089   */
090  public boolean any (Predicate<T> f) {
091    Opt<T> e;
092    for (;;) {
093      e = fnext.get();
094      if (e.isNone()) return false;
095      if (f.test(e.getValue())) return true;
096    }
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns a new Iter adding elements of it after elements of this.
101   * @param it Another Iter.
102   * @return A new Iter adding elements of it after elements of this.
103   */
104  public Iter<T> concat (Iter<T> it) {
105    return new Iter<>(() -> {
106      Opt<T> e = fnext.get();
107      if (e.isNone()) return it.fnext.get();
108      return e;
109    });
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Returns 'this' with elements resting after removing those ones returned
114   *    by 'take'.
115   * @param n Elements counter.
116   * @return 'this' with elements resting after removing those ones returned
117   *    by 'take'.
118   */
119  public Iter<T> drop (int n) {
120    while (n > 0) {
121      if (fnext.get().isNone()) break;
122      --n;
123    }
124    return this;
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Returns a new Iter with elements resting after removing those ones returned
129   *    by 'takeWhile'.
130   * @param f Function to test elements.
131   * @return A new Iter with elements resting after removing those ones returned
132   *    by 'takeWhile'.
133   */
134  public Iter<T> dropWhile (Predicate<T> f) {
135    Opt<T> e;
136    for (;;) {
137      e = fnext.get();
138      if (e.isNone()) return this;
139      if (!f.test(e.getValue())) break;
140    }
141    return unary(e.getValue()).concat(this);
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Executes 'f' with each element.
146   * @param f Function to apply.
147   */
148  public void each (Consumer<T> f) {
149    Opt<T> e;
150    for (;;) {
151      e = fnext.get();
152      if (e.isNone()) break;
153      f.accept(e.getValue());
154    }
155  }
156
157  /**
158   * Executes 'f' with each element and its index.
159   * @param f Function to apply.
160   */
161  public void each (BiConsumer<T, Integer> f) {
162    int n = 0;
163    Opt<T> e;
164    for (;;) {
165      e = fnext.get();
166      if (e.isNone()) break;
167      f.accept(e.getValue(), n);
168      ++n;
169    }
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Returns the number of elements.
174   * @return Number of elements.
175   */
176  public int count () {
177    int n = 0;
178    while (!fnext.get().isNone()) ++n;
179    return n;
180  }
181
182  /**
183   * Returns 'true' if 'this' and 'it' have the same elments in the same order.
184   * @param it Another Iter.
185   * @param f Equals function.
186   * @return 'true' if 'this' and 'it' have the same elments in the same order.
187   */
188  public boolean eq (Iter<T> it, BiPredicate<T, T> f) {
189    Opt<T> e;
190    Opt<T> e2;
191    for (;;) {
192      e = fnext.get();
193      e2 = it.fnext.get();
194      if (e.isNone()){
195         if (e2.isNone()) return true;
196         else return false;
197      }
198      if (e2.isNone()) return false;
199      if (!f.test(e.getValue(), e2.getValue())) return false;
200    }
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Returns an Iter with the elements wich produce 'true' with 'filter'.
205   * @param f Filter to apply.
206   * @return Iter with the elements wich produce 'true' with 'filter'.
207   */
208  public Iter<T> filter (Predicate<T> f) {
209    return new Iter<>(() -> {
210      Opt<T> e;
211      for (;;) {
212        e = fnext.get();
213        if (e.isNone() || f.test(e.getValue())) return e;
214      }
215    });
216  }
217
218  /**
219   * Returns the first element of 'this' such that 'f(e)' is 'true' or None if
220   * it is not found.
221   * @param f Function to test.
222   * @return Option.
223   */
224  public Opt<T> find (Predicate<T> f) {
225    Opt<T> e;
226    for (;;) {
227      e = fnext.get();
228      if (e.isNone() || f.test(e.getValue())) return e;
229    }
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns the index ot the first element of 'this' such that 'f(e)' is 'true'
234   * or -1 if it is not found.
235   * @param f Function to test.
236   * @return Option.
237   */
238  public int index (Predicate<T> f) {
239    int n = 0;
240    Opt<T> e;
241    for (;;) {
242      e = fnext.get();
243      if (e.isNone()) return -1;
244      if (f.test(e.getValue())) return n;
245      ++n;
246    }
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Returns a new Iter after applying 'f' to each element of 'this'.
251   * @param <U> Type of 'f' results.
252   * @param f Function to apply.
253   * @return Iter.
254   */
255  public <U> Iter<U> map (Function<T, U> f) {
256    return new Iter<>(() -> fnext.get().bind((e) -> Opt.some(f.apply(e))));
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Returns the next element or 'Opt.none' if there are no more elements.
261   * @return The next element or 'Opt.none' if there are no more elements.
262   */
263  public Opt<T> next () {
264    return fnext.get();
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * Returns the result of apply 'f' for each element of 'this'.
269   * @param <R> Type of seed and 'f' results.
270   * @param seed First value to 'f'.
271   * @param f Function to apply succesively to '(seed, element)'.
272   * @return The result of apply 'f' for each element of 'this'.
273   */
274  public <R> R reduce (R seed, BiFunction<R, T, R> f) {
275    Opt<T> e;
276    for (;;) {
277      e = fnext.get();
278      if (e.isNone()) break;
279      seed = f.apply(seed, e.getValue());
280    }
281    return seed;
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * returns a new Iter with the first 'n' elements of 'this'.
286   * @param n Elements counter.
287   * @return A new Iter with the first 'n' elements of 'this'.<ul>
288   *    <li>if n &lt; 0, the new Iter is empty.
289   *    <li>If n >= a.size(), the new Iter is equals to 'this'.
290   * </ul>
291   */
292  public Iter<T> take (int n) {
293    int[] ix = new int[]{0};
294    return new Iter<>(() -> {
295      Opt<T> e = fnext.get();
296      if (e.isNone() || ix[0]++ >= n) return Opt.none();
297      return e;
298    });
299  }
300
301  /**
302   * Returns a new Iter with elements of 'this' while f returns true.
303   * @param f Function to test elements of 'a'.
304   * @return A new Iter with elements of 'this' while f returns true.
305   */
306  public Iter<T> takeWhile (Predicate<T> f) {
307    boolean[] fail = new boolean[]{false};
308    return new Iter<>(() -> {
309      if (fail[0]) return Opt.none();
310
311      Opt<T> e = fnext.get();
312      if (e.isNone() || !f.test(e.getValue())) {
313        fail[0] = true;
314        return Opt.none();
315      }
316      return e;
317    });
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Feturns an Array with elements of 'this'.
322   * @return Array with elements of 'this'.
323   */
324  public ArrayList<T> toArr () {
325    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
326    for (;;) {
327      Opt<T> e = fnext.get();
328      if (e.isNone()) break;
329      r.add(e.getValue());
330    }
331    return r;
332  }
333
334  /**
335   * Feturns a Lst with elements of 'this'.
336   * @return Lst with elements of 'this'.
337   */
338  public Lst<T> toLst () {
339    Lst<T> l = new Lst<>();
340    for (;;) {
341      Opt<T> e = fnext.get();
342      if (e.isNone()) break;
343      l = l.add(e.getValue());
344    }
345    return l.reverse();
346  }
347
348  @Override
349  public String toString() {
350    return "Iter[" +
351      join(map((e) ->
352        e instanceof String ? Str.quote((String)e) : e.toString()
353      ), ", ") +
354    "]";
355  }
356
357  // STATIC ------------------------------------------------
358
359  /**
360   * Returns an Iter from 'begin' to 'end'.
361   * @param begin Begin index inclusive.
362   * @param end End index exclusive.
363   * @return Iter from 'begin' to 'end'.
364   */
365  public static Iter<Integer> range (int begin, int end) {
366    int[] n = new int[]{begin};
367    return new Iter<>(() ->
368      n[0] >= end
369        ? Opt.none()
370        : Opt.some(n[0]++)
371    );
372  }
373
374  /**
375   * Returns an Iter from 0 to 'end'.
376   * @param end End index exclusive.
377   * @return Iter from 0 to 'end'.
378   */
379  public static Iter<Integer> range (int end) {
380    return range(0, end);
381  }
382
383  /**
384   * Returns an Iter with only one element.
385   * @param <T> Iter type.
386   * @param e Element.
387   * @return Iter with only one element.
388   */
389  public static <T> Iter<T> unary (T e) {
390    int[] n = new int[]{1};
391    return new Iter<>(() ->
392      n[0]-- > 0
393        ? Opt.some(e)
394        : Opt.none()
395    );
396  }
397
398  /**
399   * Joins elements of 'it' with 'sep'.
400   * @param it Iter to join.
401   * @param sep Separator.
402   * @return A String.
403   */
404  public static String join (Iter<String> it, String sep) {
405    boolean isFirst = true;
406    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
407    Opt<String> e;
408    for (;;) {
409      e = it.fnext.get();
410      if (e.isNone()) break;
411      if (isFirst) isFirst = false;
412      else sb.append(sep);
413      sb.append(e.getValue());
414    }
415    return sb.toString();
416  }
417}
